alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Prince Edward, northern Lunenburg and southwestern Nottoway Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keysville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Green Bay around 415 PM EDT. Victoria around 425 PM EDT. Kenbridge around 430 PM EDT. Nottoway around 435 PM EDT. Blackstone around 440 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Briery Creek Lake, Irby, Prince Edward Station, Briery, Arvins Store, Murdocks, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, Burkes Tavern and Scholfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Virginia.
